docs.title: Welcome to gi
docs.text: A fast, intelligent CLI tool that fetches and combines official .gitignore templates from github/gitignore into a single, deduplicated .gitignore file.

docs.title: ✨ Features
docs.text:
• 🚀 Fast: Caches templates locally for offline use
  • 🧠 Smart: Deduplicates rules across templates while preserving comments
  • 🔍 Searchable: List and search through 200+ available templates
  • 🎯 Flexible: Support for aliases, case-insensitive names, and custom output paths
  • 💪 Robust: Graceful fallback to cached content when offline
  • 🖥️ Cross-platform: Works on macOS, Linux, and Windows

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Recommended (using pipx): 

pipx install gi

Alternative (using pip): 

pip install gi

From source: 

git clone https://github.com/sempervent/gi.git
cd gi
pip install -e .

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
# Combine multiple templates
gi main python rust node

# List available templates
gi list

# Search for templates
gi search studio

# Show template content
gi show Global/JetBrains

docs.title: First Steps
docs.text: Welcome to gi! This guide will walk you through your first steps with the .gitignore combiner.

docs.title: 🎯 What is gi?
docs.text: gi is a command-line tool that helps you create comprehensive .gitignore files by combining official templates from github/gitignore. Instead of manually copying and pasting ignore rules, gi does it automatically and intelligently.

docs.title: Before gi
docs.text:
# Manual process - time consuming and error-prone
# 1. Go to github.com/github/gitignore
# 2. Find Python template
# 3. Copy content
# 4. Find Node.js template  
# 5. Copy content
# 6. Manually combine and deduplicate
# 7. Save as .gitignore

docs.title: With gi
docs.text:
# One command - fast and reliable
gi main python node

docs.title: 📋 Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before we start, make sure you have:

  • ✅ gi installed (see Installation Guide)
  • ✅ Basic familiarity with command line
  • ✅ A project directory to work with

docs.title: 🏁 Step 1: Verify Installation
docs.text:
First, let's make sure gi is working:

gi --version

You should see something like: 

gi version 0.1.0

docs.title: 🔍 Step 2: Explore Available Templates
docs.text:
Let's see what templates are available:

# List all templates
gi list

This shows you all 200+ available templates. You'll see output like:

docs.text:
Before using a template, let's see what's in it:

gi show Python

This shows the raw content of the Python template:

docs.title: 🎯 Step 5: Create Your First .gitignore
docs.text:
Now let's create a .gitignore file for a Python project:

# Create a Python .gitignore
gi main python

This creates a .gitignore file in your current directory. Let's verify it worked:

# Check if file was created
ls -la .gitignore

# View the content
head -20 .gitignore

docs.title: 🔄 Step 6: Combine Multiple Templates
docs.text:
Let's create a more comprehensive .gitignore for a full-stack project:

# Python backend + Node.js frontend
gi main python node

This combines both Python and Node.js ignore rules into one file.

docs.title: 🎨 Step 7: Use Convenient Aliases
docs.text:
gi includes aliases to make common combinations easier:

# Use aliases instead of full names
gi main python node vscode

This is equivalent to: 

gi main Python Node "Global/VisualStudioCode"

docs.title: ⚙️ Step 8: Customize Output
docs.text:
Let's try some advanced options:

# Save to a specific file
gi main python rust -o my-project/.gitignore

# Append to existing file
gi main python -a existing/.gitignore

# Force overwrite without prompting
gi main python node --force

docs.title: 🔍 Step 9: Get Diagnostic Information
docs.text:
Check the status of your gi installation:

docs.title: 🎯 Recommended: pipx (Isolated Environment)

pipx is the recommended way to install gi as it creates an isolated environment, preventing dependency conflicts.

# Install pipx if you don't have it
python -m pip install --user pipx
python -m pipx ensurepath

# Install gi
pipx install gi

Benefits: - ✅ Isolated from other Python packages - ✅ No dependency conflicts - ✅ Easy to update and uninstall - ✅ Works on all platforms

docs.title: GitHub Actions
docs.text:
name: Update .gitignore
on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 0 * * 0'  # Weekly

jobs:
  update-gitignore:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Setup gi
        run: pip install gi
      - name: Update .gitignore
        run: gi main python node react -o .gitignore
      - name: Commit changes
        run: |
          git config --local user.email "action@github.com"
          git config --local user.name "GitHub Action"
          git add .gitignore
          git commit -m "Update .gitignore" || exit 0
          git push

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Short Description Default --output -o Output file path .gitignore --append -a Append to existing file False --force -f Overwrite without prompting False --no-cache Ignore cache for this run False --update-index Refresh template list False --from Override source repository URL github/gitignore

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Basic usage
gi main python rust

# Custom output location
gi main python rust -o my-project/.gitignore

# Append to existing file
gi main python -a existing/.gitignore

# Force overwrite
gi main python node --force

# Use aliases
gi main cpp csharp vscode

# Comma-separated templates
gi main python,rust,node

docs.title: gi list
docs.text:
List all available .gitignore templates.

gi list [OPTIONS]

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Description Default --category Filter by category All --limit Limit number of results All --format Output format (table, json) table

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:

gi list

# Filter by category
gi list --category "Language/Framework"

# Limit results
gi list --limit 10

# JSON output
gi list --format json

docs.title: gi search
docs.text:
Search for .gitignore templates by name.

gi search QUERY [OPTIONS]

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • QUERY: Search term (case-insensitive)

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Description Default --category Filter by category All --limit Limit number of results All --format Output format (table, json) table

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Search for Python-related templates
gi search python

# Search for IDE templates
gi search studio

# Search with category filter
gi search python --category "Language/Framework"

# JSON output
gi search python --format json

docs.title: gi show
docs.text:
Display the raw content of a .gitignore template.

gi show TEMPLATE [OPTIONS]

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • TEMPLATE: Template name to display

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Option Description Default --lines Number of lines to show All --format Output format (text, json) text

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:

# Show first 20 lines

# Show VS Code template

# JSON format

docs.title: Cache Directory
docs.text:
gi caches templates locally for offline use:

  • Linux/macOS: ~/.cache/gi
  • Windows: %LOCALAPPDATA%\gi\cache

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: Variable Description Default GI_CACHE_DIR Custom cache directory Platform default GI_SOURCE_URL Custom source repository github/gitignore GI_NO_CACHE Disable caching False

docs.title: Configuration File
docs.text:
Create a gi.yml file in your home directory:

cache:
  directory: ~/.cache/gi
  ttl: 86400  # 24 hours

source:
  url: github/gitignore
  branch: main

output:
  format: gitignore
  header: true
  comments: true

docs.title: Common Errors
docs.text: Error Cause Solution Template not found Invalid template name Use gi list to see available templates Network error No internet connection Use cached templates or check connection Permission denied No write access Check directory permissions Cache error Corrupted cache Run gi doctor to check cache status

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Customize gi behavior with configuration options and environment variables.

docs.title: 1. Environment Variables
docs.text:
Set environment variables to customize behavior:

# Custom cache directory
export GI_CACHE_DIR="/path/to/custom/cache"

# Custom source repository
export GI_SOURCE_URL="custom/gitignore-repo"

# Disable caching
export GI_NO_CACHE="true"

docs.title: 2. Configuration File
docs.text:
Create a gi.yml file in your home directory:

# ~/.config/gi.yml or ~/gi.yml
cache:
  directory: ~/.cache/gi
  ttl: 86400  # 24 hours in seconds

source:
  url: github/gitignore
  branch: main

output:
  format: gitignore
  header: true
  comments: true

docs.title: 3. Command Line Options
docs.text:
Override settings per command:

# Use custom output
gi main python -o custom/.gitignore

# Force refresh
gi main python --update-index

# Disable cache
gi main python --no-cache

docs.title: Default Cache Locations
docs.text: Platform Cache Directory Linux ~/.cache/gi macOS ~/.cache/gi Windows %LOCALAPPDATA%\gi\cache

docs.title: Custom Cache Directory
docs.text:
# Set custom cache directory
export GI_CACHE_DIR="/path/to/custom/cache"

# Or use command line
gi main python --cache-dir /path/to/custom/cache

docs.title: Cache Management
docs.text:
# Check cache status
gi doctor

# Clear cache manually
rm -rf ~/.cache/gi  # Linux/macOS
rmdir /s %LOCALAPPDATA%\gi\cache  # Windows

# Refresh cache
gi main python --update-index

export HTTPS_PROXY="http://proxy.company.com:8080"

docs.text:

docs.text:

docs.title: Q: How do I change the cache directory?
docs.text:
A: Set the GI_CACHE_DIR environment variable: 

export GI_CACHE_DIR="/path/to/custom/cache"

docs.title: Q: How do I use a custom template repository?
docs.text:
A: Set the GI_SOURCE_URL environment variable: 

export GI_SOURCE_URL="your-org/custom-gitignore"

docs.title: Q: How do I disable caching?
docs.text:
A: Set the GI_NO_CACHE environment variable: 

export GI_NO_CACHE="true"

docs.title: Q: How do I use a proxy?
docs.text:
A: Set the standard proxy environment variables: 

export HTTP_PROXY="http://proxy.company.com:8080"
export HTTPS_PROXY="http://proxy.company.com:8080"

docs.title: Q: How do I debug issues?
docs.text:
A: Use the gi doctor command and check the verbose output: 

gi doctor --verbose
